tasks.task: Assess the impact of Indian summer monsoon rainfall on GDP and food grain production.
subtasks: Understand the importance of monsoon in agriculture and economy.
Analyze the historical data of Indian summer monsoon rainfall (ISMR) from 1876.
Examine the relationship between ISMR anomalies and food grain production variations.
Fit exponential curves to model long-term growth trends in GDP and food grain production.
Quantitatively assess the impact of monsoon variability on GDP and food grain production.
Address the asymmetry in the impact of monsoon anomalies (negative impact is larger than positive impact).
Investigate the role of cropping patterns, fertilizer, and pesticide use in yield gaps.
Discuss the non-linear relationship between monsoon rainfall and economic impact.
Consider the implications for food security and agricultural policies in response to monsoon variability.
